channel.title: Modded Minecraft
channel.description:
As most of you know, last year we hosted a modded minecraft server called Feed the Beast. The season we had was a resounding success with quite a reasonable amount of very active players enjoying the aspects of the modified gameplay. Unfortunately due to the modpack we used at the time, alot of factors caused by the mods contributed to a large amount of lag. This lag eventually put a strain on mitb's server and consequently the server had to be closed.
Recently the Moparcraft staff team have been considering opening up another modded server. Myself and [url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=63268]Kickingjamie[/url] have been scrupulously exploring the current options regarding modpacks by focusing on gameplay, amount of server resources required, player safety and generally the longevity of the game so endgame materials are not immediately available.
Through this one modpack has arisen. The Feed the Beast subreddit have come together and constructed a modpack with an extensive quantity of mods allowing for each person's play style to be as enjoyable as possible. This modpack is called TestPackPleaseIgnore.
While we have considered other modded servers, such as Tekkit and Pixelmon, these types of packs unfortunately do not have the content we would like to provide. We are searching for a pack that has a large amount of content and allows for a longer and more enjoyable experience. While they are not completely out of the picture yet, we are quite focused on the idea of another Feed the Beast season.
The purpose of this thread is to get feedback from all of you. We want everyone who is interested to be able to have their say in the future of this server and don't want to go ahead and shove something down your throat that you might not enjoy. As it stands [url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=101530]zuppers[/url] has offered to host the server and will continue to do so until members no longer wish to play.
Here are some resources you can use to explore the current modpacks available and look at more information on TestPackPleaseIgnore:
FTB website: http://www.feed-the-beast.com/ Modpacks: http://www.feed-the-beast.com/mod-packs TPPI modlist: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0AoDq0dQBZJODdGR0aENSUEp4a0FRLVhnRGNoX2lRMGc#gid=0 TPPI subreddit: http://www.reddit.com/r/TestPackPleaseIgnore/ Pack code for TPPI: MegaSharkPunch

item.title: Modded Minecraft
item.dc:creator: @kickingjamie kickingjamie
item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

The thing with tppi is that it has modified some of the recipes that gregtech would have changed, for example if we use gregtech hard mode alone then vanilla recipes like iron pick axes and so on would be different. Instead of being challenging it just becomes tedious and annoying.

So I’m pretty certain we will be using the default release of tppi without fully enabling gregtech hard mode.

Read full topic

item.title: Modded Minecraft
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“noobs are ftw, post:26, topic:541016”][quote author=kickingjamie link=topic=659885.msg4418501#msg4418501 date=1397173925]
At the moment Testpackpleaseignore offers the most quality and variety in mods whilst keeping endgame a little difficult. Which is most appealing to me. I don’t know if a poll is needed.
[/quote]

is there different difficulty settings because i feel the hardest difficulty available would be best since i cant remember what modpack had it but you could decide the difficulty of recipes and such[/quote]
Gregtech does have a hard mode, which I believe TPPI has enabled. And they also go out of their way to make things harder, IE the Ender Quarry requires 2 octuple compressed cobble (43m cobble each) to make.

Read full topic

item.title: Modded Minecraft
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

I’ve spoken about this to Moparisthebest and we’ve come to the conclusion that we’re going to put the modded server on one big ram disk, we have a large amount of ram to play with and a sufficiently powerful CPU. The main issue is disk I/O so we’re going to take advantage of the abundance of ram and put it on a ram disk. This will require a rewrite in the script though as to sync the ram disk with the actual drive, and mount it on restarts and what not. Hopefully it won’t take too long though and you’ll all be updated if any progress is made.

Read full topic

item.title: Modded Minecraft
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

We’re moving to a new server soon so I’ll speak to Moparisthebest to see if we can overcome prior technical limitations which forced us to reconsider the amount of servers we could operate. I’m in the process of rewriting the management script (which handles backups and what not) and just making it into one modular script that uses more efficient means of storage (such as rdiff) as opposed to the current mess that’s spread across lots of mini scripts. I’ve just finished pruning a lot of unnecessary backups (300gb in total, heh) so we should be moving shortly.

There are (as usual) plans to direct traffic over here from outside the community but if they become more attainable I’ll post about them.

Read full topic
